list.description: DemocracyOS is an open-source web application designed to improve the chances of citizen to participate in decision-making processes. This is the technological manifestation of our main mision: to bring the political system closer to those behaviors and technologies of this century.
Civic stack is a showcase for open-source civic tech. It has been designed collaboratively as a window to show together all these technologies that are meant to empower citizens.

SOLE crafts self-organized learning environments, based on the pedagogy of Sugata Mitra. It involves many children, a few computers and one big question. The Internet transforms the way we learn, also in the schools of Buenos Aires.

rinnp.description: We’re a group of Latin Americans affected by the state of democracy in our region. On July 1st, 2016, we met up in Buenos Aires and set ourselves the aim of building a network. Our first step was to collectively write a letter that speaks of our principles, values and political goals. We are united by the dream of a democracy of commons, a democracy that redistributes power, increases political inclusion and promotes human rights.

bookone.title: Recuperar la política
bookone.description: The economic, technological and cultural transformations of the last decades raise new questions: How do we face these challenges? How are power and democracy organized in a liquid society? How are jurisdictions of public policies defined in increasingly global societies, economies and issues? It is in this setting where initiatives to renew politics arise and find meaning.

booktwo.title: ¿Qué democracia para el siglo XXI?
booktwo.description: As social and political activists from all over Latin America we wonder: What democracy can we build in our social and technological context?
